In this case, Jennie paid $310 for renting the car for 11 years.<n><n>## Question 2<n><n>> Total driving time is 14 and 160.<n><n>## Question3<n><n>> The total cost for Eric for renting the carriage house for 20 day is $800<n><n>## Question 4<n><n>> Total driving hour per year is 72<n><n>## Question 5<n><n>> Since there are 5 boys in total and seven girls, the number of girls is 5 plus 7 times 5/9, boys plus 5:7:180. The boys share $3900 so they will receive an amount of $2560.<n><n><n>## Question 6<n><n>> Since $1700 is the cost of ambulance ride, $1700 plus 100 plus 50 plus 10 is 3610 for total bill.<n><n>## Question7<n><n>> Since 3/6 is 5/9, 55*5/14 is 55*14/9 or 715 and 101*5/9 is 101*14=1410. For total value of harvested carrots is 2125.<n><n>## Question8<n><n>>There are 23 guests of Iris for the birthday party<n><n>## Question9<n><n>Total cost of pair of shoes is $200<n><n>## Input:<n>What is the answer to the following?<n><n>### Input<n>Sam left his muddy sneakers in the entryway. I would first decide between which city or which state I would like the house to be in. After I have made up my mind about which location I want the house in, I would search for the different areas within that location.  After I find a particular area or neighborhood that I like, I would inspect the houses and decide which one to get.  Then I would put a bid on the house or put a bid on a nearby house. A bidding price is usually an estimated amount that a new owner (the new bidder) would be willing to pay on a house.)<n><n>(If I am the owner, I would either agree to let the new bidder buy the house, or I would decline.)<n><n>### Response A:I would agree to the bid.<n><n>### Response B: I would not agree to the bid.

Is John taller than his neighbor?<n><n>### Responses: Yes he is, Because 204% - 14% =34%, so 204-140.06>152.<n><n>### Input(s): John has three times as much money as Bill.  By how much must Bill’s money be increased to have exactly twice the amount that John does?<n><n>### Output: John has 200 dollars, Bill $100 and John has to double(2x) Bill’s mony, so Bill’s money x 2 means he will have $200, the solution is $100<n><n>Input(s): Jack was on a boat.  He was three miles from shore by the north-east side. After two hours he turned and rowed a distance of 7 miles by the south-east side before returning to shore.  By which direction did he row, and how far?<n><n>### Analysis:First Jack was three miles from shore, and then he turned and rowed and went 7 miles, so 7-3 = 4. Then to reach shore he turned an additional 2 hours, so one hour of rowing would be 6 miles, and when he returned he went 3 miles south east from shore. So he rowed a total of 13 miles.<n><n><n>### Input-Question(s) :If you cut 10 pounds of cheese, you got 3 pounds of scraps and 7 pounds of cheese.  What was the original amount of cheese you had?<n><n>### Analyzing-Response(s): First the answer is 17 pounds of cheese, because 5/7 < 10/x, and then there are 7 pounds of chease and 3 pounds of scrape, and then divide

If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>Input: Lyra bought a pair of shoes at a 20% discount.  If she paid $480, how much was the original price of the pair of shoes?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:If I have a forgiving attitude toward someone, what do they receive? Choices:  A: redemption B: isolation C: absolution D: great relief E: feel better<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The answer is B.<n><n>### Input.The price of gas is $1.25 per gallon. If she has $140 for all of the sheep and cows combined, how much does each animal cost?<n><n>### Answer: The ratio of sheep:cows is 5:4 and $140 is shared by both sheep and cows. So, the cost of sheep + the cost of cows must be less than $140. This means that the cost of both sheep and cows must equal or less than $14.  Cost of sheep = $140/5 = $28. Cost of cows = $140/(4+5) = $20. So, the cost for each animal is $28, since it was $140 for both combined, and $20 for cows alone.<n><n><n>### InputFill in the blank: If

How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>Input: Lyra bought a pair of shoes at a 20% discount.  If she paid $480, how much was the original price of the pair of shoes?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What happens when people are waiting for something? Choices:  A: read book B: getting bored C: worry D: singing E: s never comes<n><n>### Response:		<n>**Answer is B**<n><n>###  Input:When you are driving how do you know where the other cars are? Choices: A: radar detection B: you read people’s minds C: radar gun D: other cars can read your mind E: radar detector.<n><n>### Response<n>**Answer is D**<n><n>### Input1:If you were to win a car in a contest from a radio station, what could be your motivation to answer all of their questions if you want to win the car? Choices: A. the money B. you get a free car C. the fame D. the publicity E. to get your name in the newspaper<n><n>### Response1:<n>**Answer is E**<n><n>### Output<n><n>### Input2:If you were to want to play in the NBA, you would most likely to have to play at what level? Choices: A) High school B) Middle school C) College D) Pro Team E) Summer school.<n><n>### Input3:There are 3 apples, and in the jar there is 1 apple. If the number of apples is 1 less than the number in the jar, then _______<n><n>### Response2:<n>**Answer is D.  There are now 2 apples.**<n><n>### Instructions: You will be provided multiple questions in each section that you are to provide the output that will be generated from that question. The output will be a multiple choice question that your output will be able to correctly answer that would otherwise not be correct. The output question may have 2 or 3 different correct answers. <n><n>### Demos:<n>Input: What is the sum of 81, 24, 46, and 21?<n>Answer: <n><n>Input: What is another term for "winter solstice?"<n>Answer: <n>

The day before yesterday<n>2. Twice the day before yesterday<n>3. Yesterday<n>4. The day I was born<n>5. The day after tomorrow<n><n>Answer: The day I was born.<n><n>### Input:[ The day before yesterday, the day after tomorrow, twice the day before yesterday ](2)<n>* [ 1 ](3)<n>* [ 2 ](5)<n>* [ 3 ](4)<n>* [ 4 ](1)<n>* [ 5 ](2)<n>### Instruactions:<n>1. I was working when I received the phone call.<n>2. The number is in two digits, between 0 and 10.<n><n>* Input:[ the number is in two digits ](1)<n><n>### Instuckshun:<n>How many?<n>1. 38<n>2. 466<n><n>### Input[ The correct answer to my question would have been: 20 ](1)<n>Answer:[ 52 ](163)<n><n>### In the question:<n><n>* When is a person born? This may have confused a few people. Here is an example of each answer (20 = 2000).<n><n>* The birthday is the day before yesterday.<n>* The birthday happens the day before yesterday. That same day, the person turns two the day after.<n>* People are born the day before yesterday. The birthday party is in two days.<n>* Children’s birthdays fall on the day before yesterday, twice the day before. They are two years old the day after.<n><n>### What number is in between 0 and 4<n><n>1. 1<n>2. 2<n>3. 3<n><n>### Instraction:<n>Sue was on a cruise ship and wanted to stay on the same deck as her

Choices:  A: sum B: likeness C: alike D: sameness E: similarity<n><n>### Response:		<n>It is unlikely you can get your answer by simply adding all the numbers together as the answer is actually something larger than 1000 but not larger than 10.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>What would be the total number of miles on a trip if 10 people are traveling a distance of 80 miles each?<n>I’m not entirely sure what the instructions are trying to achieve but perhaps you can work out a solution from the clues given.<n><n>### Response<n>There would be a total of 800miles.<n><n>### 2 Inputs:<n>You buy ten apples for $2.00 each.  You will need two of them for a family meal.  How much, in dollars will you spend for the ten apples?<n>A friend asks if you want a 6-mile ride to the store. How much does she charge you?<n>You could probably do this by thinking back to your school days when you did times tables as one solution is simply 10 * 6 = 60 <n>However a slightly more clever solution would be the formula 60 x 2 / 10 = 2.<n><n>### Output:<n>There would simply be 2 dollars.<n>You would not want to take the 6 mile ride as we would end up travelling 6 miles back and forth for a total of 12 miles.

Choices:  A: gain experience B: taking notes C: listen carefully D: complete test E: focus<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Task name:<n>Four people decided to share the rent on a two bedroom apartment.<n>In total, they paid the landlord $2600 for six months of rent.<n><n>Roger pays $50 more.<n><n>His share of the rent is 75%.<n><n>How much in total did Roger pay in one month?<n><n><n>### Solution<n>Total of six months of rent = 2600<n>Monthly share of rent = 2(10/15)<n>Month of Roger = 15/10 = 75/10<n>Monthly rent for Roger = (75/10)*2600=$230<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Jeremy works for a market research firm that is conducting a survey to establish what time of day consumers are most likely to use specific retail stores. If she paid $480, how much was the original price of the pair of shoes?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What could happen to you after you see some beautiful clouds above you? Choices:  A: plain B: cold C: dull D: bad E: wet<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: A plain, because it might rain<n><n>### Input<n>### Output<n>### Challenge<n>### Review<n><n>1. What could happen to you after seeing some beautiful clouds above you<n><n>2. What could happen to your pencil after you erase something<n><n><n>### Challenge<n>what could happen to you after watching a sad movie<n><n>What would happen to you if you left your car parked on the street and the car got stolen?<n><n>What might happen to you after you eat a tangerine<n><n>### Challenge 10<n><n>1. How much did you lose if your friend borrows $25 and gives you back only $20<n><n>2. What can happen if the price of tomatoes increases<n><n>3. If the price of a loaf of bread increases by 15%, what happens if you buy the same loaf of bread for $3.80<n><n>4. What can happen if you watch a television show with bad content<n><n>5. What can happen if your parents gave the lawnmower to the friend who borrowed it<n><n>6. What can happen if i drive over 25 mph in the neighborhood<n><n>### Code review <n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>Input: Lyra bought a pair of shoes at a 20% discount.  If she paid $480, how much was the original price of the pair of shoes?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:When a snake prefers warm, sunny weather, where would it likely want to live?
